keywords: Food Matters: A Guide to Conscious Eating
name: Cook the Book: Orchiette with Broccoli Rabe
description: Cooking pasta Bittman-style means upending the traditional ratio of pasta to sauce and creating a dish with half a pound of pasta for every two to four cups of sauce. You may be skeptical, but it's certainly worth a try;...
recipeIngredient: About 1 pound broccoli rabe, trimmed and cut into pieces
1/4 cup olive oil, or more as needed
1 tablespoon chopped garlic, or more to taste
1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste
1/4 to 1/2 pound sweet or spicy Italian sausage (if using link sausage, squeeze it from the casing or cut it up a bit)
1/2 pound dried orchiette, penne, ziti, or other cut pasta, preferably whole wheat

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the pasta in the boiling water for about 5 minutes before checking the first time. When the pasta is just tender, but not quite done, drain it, reserving about a cup of the cooking water. Toss the pasta with the sauce, along with some of the pasta water to keep the pasta from drying out. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Serve immediately, with the Parmesan, if you desire.
